alert.note: Alert for Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Mercer, northwestern Whiteside, Rock Island, northwestern Henry, Scott, southeastern Clinton, east central Muscatine and east central Louisa Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Long Grove to Mannon. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Davenport, Eldridge, Long Grove and Donahue around 535 PM CDT. McCausland around 545 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Aledo, Princeton, Cordova, Low Moor, Hamlet, Camanche, Reynolds, Shale City, Viola, Albany, Matherville, Boden, Taylor Ridge, Clinton, Fulton, Garden Plain, Sherrard, Cable and East Clinton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 286 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Iowa.
